content.question: Which of the following claims is best supported by the data?

choices.label: Algae only carry out photosynthesis when exposed to <math alttext="200 micromoles per square meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">μ</mi><msup><mtext>mol·m</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mtext>·s</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>.
Algae double the rate of photosynthesis when the light intensity doubles.

Algae that are exposed to <math alttext="30 micromoles per square meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">μ</mi><msup><mtext>mol·m</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mtext>·s</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> of light perform photosynthesis instead of cellular respiration.

Algae that are exposed to <math alttext="100 micromoles per square meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">μ</mi><msup><mtext>mol·m</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mtext>·s</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> of light have a greater rate of photosynthesis than of cellular respiration over time.

content.answer: Algae that are exposed to <math alttext="100 micromoles per square meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.30em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">μ</mi><msup><mtext>mol·m</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mtext>·s</mtext><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> of light have a greater rate of photosynthesis than of cellular respiration over time.
